title: git-annex error hidden by AnnexRepo(init=True)
body:
When debugging a test failed like this (tail end of the traceback)

```
  File "/home/mih/hacking/datalad/git/datalad/support/annexrepo.py", line 1255, in _init
    annex_options=opts)
  File "/home/mih/hacking/datalad/git/datalad/support/annexrepo.py", line 1079, in _run_annex_command
    **kwargs)
  File "/home/mih/hacking/datalad/git/datalad/cmd.py", line 143, in run_gitcommand_on_file_list_chunks
    results.append(func(cmd, *args, **kwargs))
  File "/home/mih/hacking/datalad/git/datalad/cmd.py", line 1105, in run
    *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/mih/hacking/datalad/git/datalad/cmd.py", line 929, in run
    raise exc
datalad.support.exceptions.CommandError: CommandError: 'git-annex init -c annex.dotfiles=true' failed with exitcode 1 under /media/mih/Samsung_T5/tmp/datalad_temp_test_recklessd7d1qm2q [out: 'init  
failed']
```

Not very informative. Going in, and running `git annex init` manually at that point yields the following output:

```
% git annex init
init  error: unable to create temporary file: Operation not permitted
error: unable to create temporary file: Operation not permitted

git-annex: user error (git ["--git-dir=.git","--work-tree=.","--literal-pathspecs","commit-tree","4b825dc642cb6eb9a060e54bf8d69288fbee4904","--no-gpg-sign"] exited 1)
failed
git-annex: init: 1 failed
```

A lot more info, that is somewhere swallowed in DataLad -- and probably should not be.
